questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
You create an app protection policy for Android devices named Policy1 as shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Install the Intune Company Portal app on the device
On Android, Android devices will prompt to install the Intune Company Portal app regardless of which Device type is chosen.

Bix 2: Devices only -
For Android devices, unmanaged devices are devices where Intune MDM management has not been detected. This includes devices managed by third-party
MDM vendors.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/app-protection-policies#app-protection-policies-for-iosipados-and-android-apps

comments.content:
from the same reference, this cleared things up for me:
because Intune app protection policies target a user's identity, the protection settings for a user can apply to both enrolled (MDM managed) and non-enrolled devices (no MDM). Therefore, you can target an Intune app protection policy to either Intune enrolled or unenrolled iOS/iPadOS and Android devices. You can have one protection policy for unmanaged devices in which strict data loss prevention (DLP) controls are in place, and a separate protection policy for MDM managed devices, where the DLP controls may be a little more relaxed. For more information how this works on personal Android Enterprise devices

D is correct

Why not admin1 & 2
Admin1 and Admin2 cannot download the Office customization file from the Microsoft 365 Apps admin center because of their assigned roles:

Admin1 has the Application Administrator role, which allows them to manage all aspects of enterprise applications. However, this role does not grant permissions to manage Office customizations in the admin center.

Admin2 has the Cloud Application Administrator role, which provides similar permissions to the Application Administrator role but only for cloud-based applications. This role also does not grant permissions to manage Office customizations in the admin center.

Only users with the Global Administrator, Security Administrator, or Office Apps Administrator roles can manage Office customizations in the admin center. In this case, only Admin3 has the Office Apps Administrator role.

Selected Answer: C
Asked Bing
The users who can download the Office customization file from the Microsoft 365 Apps admin center are C. Admin3 only.

Here’s why:

To sign into the admin center, your account must have either the global administrator, security administrator, or Office apps administrator role.
In this case, only Admin3 has the Office apps administrator role, so only Admin3 can download the Office customization file from the admin center.
D. Admin3 and Admin4 only
To sign into the admin center, your account must have either the global administrator, security administrator, or Office apps administrator role.

Selected Answer: D
How to get to the admin center
Sign in at config.office.com with your admin account. To sign into the admin center, your account must have either the global administrator, security administrator, or Office apps administrator role.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/admincenter/overview#how-to-get-to-the-admin-center
